alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Harnett; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 2:44PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Harnett, southwestern Wake and southeastern Chatham Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 244 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fuquay-Varina, or 12 miles north of Lillington, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fuquay-Varina, Apex, Holly Springs, Harris Lake Boat Launch, Shearon Harris Reservoir, Duncan and Raven Rock State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Dont wait until you see the first lightning flash before heading to safety. Move indoors at the first sign of threatening skies or the first sound of thunder. Deadly lightning strikes can occur well ahead of an approaching storm, prior to the arrival of rain and wind. Make sure that lightning is well away from your location before resuming outdoor activity.
